title: Distinguish agent vs human actor in activity feed
description:
Activity notifications currently show the git user email for all actions, even when performed by the AI agent (ticker). This is confusing because it looks like the human made the change.

Solution: Use a distinct identifier for agent-performed actions (e.g., 'ticker' or 'agent') vs human actions (git user email). The tk CLI already has context about whether it's being run by ticker or directly by a human.
closed_reason: Set TICK_OWNER=ticker env var when ClaudeAgent runs claude CLI subprocess, ensuring tk commands executed by the agent are attributed to 'ticker' instead of the human's git email. Modified internal/agent/claude.go to inherit parent env with TICK_OWNER=ticker appended.
